column1: Freezing temperatures didn’t stop us from rallying together and marching today in Concord at the 2020 #WomensMarch. Proud to stand alongside so many dedicated advocates and allies to continue the march for progress. https://t.co/tSgTYgRHv5
Keeping our brave troops and their families in my thoughts tonight as we get these early reports. https://t.co/RHUQoRNWH3
Wishing everyone a Happy New Year! As we turn the page on 2019 let's keep working together to make progress and stand up for our nation's values. Here's to 2020!

We're up against a critical deadline tonight at midnight. We could really use your support so I'm asking you to help ring in 2020 by pitching in what you can to help us meet our goal before 2019 is over.  Chip in here: https://t.co/MjegBa3dMg https://t.co/fWQ4KLZwpY

We need the courage fight and moral clarity of @repjohnlewis now more than ever. I am so saddened to hear this news about our dear colleague and we all pray for him during his battle with cancer. https://t.co/EZqnwltiSt

These anti-Semitic attacks are horrific and heartbreaking especially during this season of light and hope. There’s no place in America for this and we must stand up to hate wherever we see it. https://t.co/xfboFSfQPg
Merry Christmas to all those celebrating! I hope you all have a happy and joyous holiday surrounded by family and friends.
May all those celebrating the first night of Hanukkah this evening be filled with joy hope and light.   Chag sameach!
Today guided by the facts and my conscience I’ll honor my oath of office to support and defend the Constitution. https://t.co/PCahWqmXiq

Our nation’s founders created a government with shared powers and co-equal branches of government. They gave us the presidency not a monarchy. They created a system where no one is above the law even the President of the United States. https://t.co/JZG8X6MNN9

7 years ago 26 children and educators were senselessly killed at Sandy Hook.  We must hold their memories close and work to prevent other families from experiencing this unimaginable loss.  We must press for reforms that can save lives and call out those who stand in our way. https://t.co/ZhpnSs9Wx7
The guy has a point! Great to see fellow Puritan & Central HS alum @AdamSandler on 60 Minutes tonight! https://t.co/yCttk40Dup

What can be said that hasn’t been said after so many tragedies?  Action is needed to keep our kids educators and school professionals safe.   It’s time to put their lives ahead of the powerful industry lobby that prevents us from passing common sense legislation. https://t.co/HppnaEsYx0
@Chas10Buttigieg @DJJudd Only way to do it!

One year ago today I was proud to earn the trust of Granite Staters in #NH01. Thanks to all those who made this possible. Let’s keep working to make progress and bring people together around solutions. #nhpolitics https://t.co/4Ovl383UuY
Congratulations Andrew Hosmer the next Mayor of Laconia! Andrew is a dedicated public servant and will be a thoughtful leader and champion for the people of Laconia.

Congratulations to @JoyceCraigNH on her historic victory tonight!   Joyce has delivered meaningful results for the people of Manchester in all of our neighborhoods and I look forward to continuing to work with her to build on the progress she has made.
In Somersworth polls are open until 7 p.m. and you can look up your polling place and find more information here: https://t.co/KhwMHudmYW
If you are a Rochester voter your polls are open until 7 p.m. tonight and you can look up your polling place and other election information here: https://t.co/hsyUWNFBpt
In Laconia polls are open until 6 p.m. and you can find more polling information and election details here: https://t.co/uGBWyKzHx7

There are several other elections happening in the First District today including ⬇️  In Dover polls are open until 7 p.m. tonight and you can find your polling place and ward information here: https://t.co/7jELiCCekr
Manchester voters can head the polls today until they close at 7 p.m. tonight. You can look up your polling place and find more election information here: https://t.co/6ko1HRWdzu

It’s Election Day in cities across New Hampshire! Make sure you get out to vote and make your voice heard.   In Manchester I hope you’ll support my friend @JoyceCraigNH. She has been leading our city in the right direction and deserves another two years. https://t.co/Lxe5STlawS

Our choice is Joyce!  Great to join @JeanneShaheen  @Maggie_Hassan and an office full of volunteers in Manchester to kick off GOTV weekend for our friend @JoyceCraigNH!    Be sure to vote on November 5th ➡️ https://t.co/jb3n2wAbOz https://t.co/HO8JjUREqw
Rainy Sunday but the colors were beautiful in my neighborhood today! https://t.co/uISbHMkKTo
@Abby4Iowa @DanWasta Great news! Congrats Abby and Daniel!

I’m saddened to learn of the passing of Mary Stuart Gile a longtime New Hampshire legislator. No one fought harder for children and families at the State House and I was honored to know and serve alongside her. We will miss her.
Amazing look at the fall foliage above Crawford Notch in Hart’s Location from our hike today with AMC folks. Get up there and check out the peak colors this weekend! 🍂 🍁 🍂 https://t.co/LPhfUAInk6

Kicked off a day in the Lakes Region by touring infrastructure improvement projects in Laconia with City Councilor Andrew Hosmer. Investing in our infrastructure improves our economy public safety and quality of life. https://t.co/z84ssq2n9e

It’s Election Day in Epping! My friend @NaomiAndrewsNH will be a tireless advocate for local families in the Statehouse.  I hope Epping voters will get out and vote today at the Epping Middle School gym - polls are open until 7 PM.
@RonShaw80 Thanks so much for your help!

⏰ Time’s almost up!  We need your support by midnight tonight to close out our fundraising quarter and show our strong commitment to holding this swing seat in 2020.  Chip in here >>> https://t.co/LNQdYrpq1A
This is a disgusting attack on Joe’s family. Go get ‘em @JoeCunninghamSC https://t.co/WMxj05UmpY
We must put country first—and the constitution and rule of law along with it. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/WpBUnXtjZT

Congratulations @JoyceCraigNH on your win - with the largest share of the vote by a Mayoral candidate in a primary in over 20 years.   Let’s roll up our sleeves and make sure Mayor Craig returns to City Hall in November to keep working for Manchester.  https://t.co/Na8RSOodoC

Today is primary day in Manchester!  My friend @JoyceCraigNH has been a tireless advocate for Manchester residents and has made our community better.   Find your polling place and vote - polls close at 7pm ➡️ https://t.co/jb3n2wAbOz

Let’s keep working and keep our eye on the ball. In the chaos of the Trump era we can’t lose sight of what’s at stake & who we are.  If you're ready to reclaim an America that is decent big-hearted and forward-thinking join us: https://t.co/j6cJayFwrv #NHDems2020 #NHpolitics https://t.co/7fH8PDFli0

Wishing a very happy birthday to @AnnMcLaneKuster!   Whether working together in Congress or rappelling down a tall building in Manchester I couldn't ask for a better friend and colleague. https://t.co/pkh4yqSfjv
Great to join you in Kensington. Glad we coordinated our shirts! #nhpolitics https://t.co/HlCCevWETd

All members of Congress should have the opportunity to visit Israel and learn about the challenges and need for peace. I am deeply disappointed that the President politicizes our relationship with Israel and the PM has banned colleagues from visiting. https://t.co/xxF1uMYUIM

The mass shootings in Dayton and El Paso are the latest example of our ongoing uniquely American tragedy.    It does not have to be this way.  The House has passed common sense legislation for universal background checks. We must demand Mitch McConnell take this up now.
El Paso is a beautiful compassionate community—I was there yesterday with colleagues on a trip to the border. My heart breaks for the city and the victims of today’s horrific mass shooting.
The evidence of climate change is all around us but the rapid melting of Greenland’s ice sheet is particularly alarming. We must act with the urgency this crisis demands.  https://t.co/t7JtdWSrIx

We should not be imposing unnecessary barriers to voting that make it harder for some - including young people -  to participate and have their voices heard in New Hampshire. That's just not who we are as a state.  https://t.co/V2vidrgLXR
A beautiful day in Wakefield! Great to join the Moose Mountain Area Democrats at the Doctor’s House this afternoon. https://t.co/tdAZIGohgw
Thanks for your advocacy for N.H. women and families! #NHPolitics https://t.co/kmH3Z2nFhz
We take #NationalIceCreamDay pretty seriously here on #TeamPappas. https://t.co/OLeJf6QFdd

Thank you to everyone who turned out to our 2nd Annual Ice Cream Social in Manchester! It was great to see longtime friends meet so many new ones and of course serve up plenty of ice cream. https://t.co/XrRJ2VCZBq

Tonight's the night! I'll be scooping ice cream at our 2nd annual Ice Cream Social starting at 6pm. Looking forward to catching up with friends and having a great time.   RSVP: https://t.co/NqcGM9rA1l   Got a favorite🍦 flavor? Let us know ⬇️

Tomorrow is the day🍦! There are still a few spots left - so don't wait any longer to RSVP to our 2nd annual Ice Cream Social.   Thank you @amyklobuchar for supporting our campaign and sponsoring this event.  RSVP: https://t.co/NqcGM9rA1l https://t.co/TXMfwDzrD9

Thrilled to have @ewarren as a sponsor of our 2nd annual Ice Cream Social! The room is filling up but there is still time to join us.   You can RSVP here : https://t.co/NqcGM9rA1l   #nhpolitics #nh01 https://t.co/KsoX2KwDEX

Thank you Vice President @JoeBiden for sponsoring our 2nd annual Ice Cream Social and supporting our campaign!   There are just a few days left so make sure you RSVP today: https://t.co/NqcGM9rA1l #NHpolitics #NH01 https://t.co/lYfY3quMLG

Looking forward to our 2nd annual Ice Cream Social coming up on Saturday July 20 at 6 pm!   There's still room to RSVP so I hope to see you there: https://t.co/NqcGM9rA1l #NHpolitics #NH01 https://t.co/B5kNVEt7CG

Once again the President is debasing American values and his office with a xenophobic rant that has no basis in fact. My colleagues in Congress are Americans and our nation is better off because of our diversity.
This needed to happen but this shouldn’t be the only consequence for protecting a child predator. https://t.co/5AuSovR4sm
Happy Independence Day! Wishing everyone a fun and safe #4thofJuly! https://t.co/Jnx1z7ja5x

I hope you'll join us for our 2nd Annual Ice Cream Social on Saturday July 20th at my favorite place to get a scoop -- the Puritan in Manchester.  You can RSVP at https://t.co/NqcGM9rA1l #nhpolitics #NH01 https://t.co/LcX7c46TBR

With a majority of American supporting the Equality Act it is a matter of when--not if--the LGBTQ community will gain full equality under the law. It is time to live up to our nation’s promise and pass the #EqualityAct into law. https://t.co/hw6maOwmcl
Great day Saturday at Portsmouth Pride! Thanks to Seacoast Outright and the community for creating an inclusive celebration that shows everyone is welcome in N.H. #NHPolitics https://t.co/4jTQuERyx3
Nice to meet you as well!  Happy #Pride ! https://t.co/5YhREmJZ6p
@gimmie_a_tweet Congrats on making it this far! As long as I’m in NH I’ll make time to join for a few miles.

As a lifelong Manchester resident it's exciting to celebrate the progress the LGBTQ community has made among so many great friends and allies at the Queen City Pride Festival. Happy #Pride everyone! https://t.co/WxIY6hNyUI
My mother is very crafty—her cookies were delicious! https://t.co/eDNZJfYJXT

Join me in signing @taylorswift13's petition to urge the Senate to pass the #EqualityAct. As a co-chair of the Equality Caucus I couldn't be more proud to have her support to end discrimination against millions of Americans. https://t.co/KUZEnRGFUL
Proud to receive @LCVoters endorsement. We have much work to do to protect our environment invest in clean energy and address climate change head on. I look forward to joining LCV in these fights.
Loving the new addition to our DC office ... a N.H. themed puzzle from a great N.H. business @WhiteMtnPuzzles! https://t.co/9k62qJyGjM
America is for Dreamers. Proud to support this bipartisan immigration bill that recognizes the dignity of millions who know no other country than the United States. #DreamAct https://t.co/7XPexFPfUD
Thanks to the friends leaders advocates & allies who made Concord Pride such an outstanding celebration today. I enjoyed kicking off #PrideMonth with you! 🏳️‍🌈 https://t.co/Rs1KeyUajH
Not again.  Horrific news from Virginia Beach.  Please keep the victims their families and the community in your thoughts. https://t.co/1YAh393eJG
Count me in. https://t.co/T7JmCCbXER
Don’t you mean Puritan Backroom Alex? https://t.co/xlzixmWLD3
Nice meeting you and best of luck with your research this summer! https://t.co/5gL4yZyjbq

I stand with those who are out protesting to #StopTheBans today in Concord Portsmouth Exeter and at rallies across the country. We must defeat these extreme abortion bans that seek to erode Roe v. Wade and women's reproductive rights. https://t.co/Fkt60jjYdC

Just left the House floor after passing the #EqualityAct. As the 1st LGBTQ member of Congress from NH I was proud to be part of history & deliver on the promise of equality. Let's make this one count. https://t.co/OMpN50mEKu

WATCH: I'm headed to the House floor to vote for the #EqualityAct. Today is a proud day in Washington. We're asking for full equality under the law nothing less nothing more. Let's get this done. https://t.co/UKYxnF34Xx

Great to see the new statue for inventor Ralph Baer in Arms Park today. Ralph escaped Nazi Germany and eventually settled in Manchester pioneering the first video game console (also the game Simon). https://t.co/kraPC7lWG1
Barr should resign. We can’t get to the bottom of obstruction of justice if there’s obstruction at Justice. https://t.co/hDu8HwUPGr
Happy Easter to all those celebrating today! Wishing you and your family peace and happiness. #GreekEaster #ChristosAnesti https://t.co/b002RsO942

Thanks to the @DoverNHDems for having me last night! One election only changes so much and we must keep working to support policies and candidates who will move our state and nation forward. https://t.co/ryCQlear3g

We need to do everything we can to protect voting rights in New Hampshire. So glad to see a great many Presidential candidates heed @JeanneShaheen's call to oppose the bill that could disenfranchise eligible NH voters. https://t.co/FY2L2Hkjef
Thanks @JeanneShaheen for taking national leadership on this. I hope every Presidential candidate will support your push for voting rights in NH. https://t.co/Go9zwHU1Jg
It’s heartbreaking to see deadly violence claiming the lives of worshipers in Sri Lanka this Easter Sunday. No Christian Jew or Muslim should be targeted or become a victim because of their faith.
It’s refreshing to see the way Granite Staters can come together in community settings and hear each other out. We need more of this. #NHPolitics https://t.co/JUl4BCAd9g
$0 https://t.co/95CS7IN0Ak

Our #NH01 team is doing an outstanding job serving the people of the First Congressional District. I couldn't be more proud of their work and I'm so glad to have them all here in New Hampshire this week. https://t.co/MlIrdXUc2q

It was an uplifting morning at the @BGCofManchester Foundation of Friends Breakfast. The Club helps secure a brighter future for the kids and our community and it’s great to see the strong support for its mission. https://t.co/3U7C5XW4TZ

Even in heartbreak there's hope. Thinking of the people of Paris and the brave firefighters who prevented even worse damage to this religious and cultural landmark. I hope we will be celebrating a rebuilt #NotreDame before too long. https://t.co/wYTBgIm2aW
Good luck to all those running the #BostonMarathon today! 🏃‍♀️ 🏃🏻 https://t.co/lWMMIpNgUX

9/11 is seared in our collective memory & we can never forget the horror of that day or the victims & families. We can’t tolerate anyone using this tragedy for political purposes especially @POTUS. The disgraceful targeting of a Muslim-American colleague is beneath his office. https://t.co/ibKoA60X0M
This is silly. We should be encouraging students to take an interest in politics and government not censoring their speech. #NHPolitics https://t.co/1luEz95xKY
Our office is always happy to help constituents see our nation’s capital! https://t.co/X6oH9O82Qw
Toula and I both started working at @PuritanBackroom in 1994. It was so nice she stopped by to visit my new workplace (and lobby me on Greek issues of course!). https://t.co/2t2IxsyuN5
The Clews family will be hosting me in Portsmouth this Saturday at 7pm and we hope you can't resist joining us!  Email [meagan at chrispappas dot org] for more details. https://t.co/ZONGos3Cwk

We must keep Manchester moving forward. @JoyceCraigNH is doing an outstanding job fighting for us and strengthening our city and it’s future. That’s why I’m eager to support her re-election bid in the coming months. https://t.co/gTHRZgzV5N
It’s always great to host Granite Staters at our office! Thanks for brightening my day @jalfordteaster! https://t.co/ujUssPYlpk
We only have 10 more hours to reach our goal... https://t.co/W6Lxo2enMe https://t.co/y4a3JHHlXm

Lots of laughs at this morning's @ManchesterDems St. Patrick's Breakfast honoring & roasting @SenCavanaugh. Thanks to @GeneMartin for putting together another wonderful event to support local candidates. https://t.co/a3veHIfEXg

Manchester's own @GirlsAtWorkInc is doing incredible work to empower girls in our communities by teaching them about carpentry camaraderie and leadership. Proud to support their effort & join them last night to kick off their Diva Night event. https://t.co/Mzv0F7Ai0f

Happy birthday to the incomparable Mayor @JoyceCraigNH. So proud to call her my mayor. Her leadership is taking Manchester in a great direction both for this generation and the next. https://t.co/kHHgF4naBW

Our first fundraising deadline is coming up at midnight tomorrow. Please chip in $5 to tell Chris thank you for not taking a dime of corporate PAC money. https://t.co/W6Lxo2enMe https://t.co/k2fFpkwLmy
Happy Greek Independence Day! Zito Hellas! #ΖητώηΕλλάς https://t.co/imQZwt7pJ0
Same here! Welcome back to #FITN. https://t.co/kQNJKBD3wC
At the Waypoint #Sleepout in Downtown Manchester with Mayor @JoyceCraigNH. We're drawing attention to the issue of youth homelessness. #NoRestUntil https://t.co/uCYnNuhXW9

Tonight I'm joining @GovChrisSununu & @MayorJoyceCraig to #SleepOut in downtown Manchester in order to raise awareness for youth homelessness and support the programs at Waypoint. https://t.co/IrMluyr8xm

Proud to be among the first members of Congress endorsed by @StopBigMoney. I'm proud to have run and won with grassroots support and without corporate PAC money. We have much work to do to change Washington and have a government that works #ForThePeople. https://t.co/LAm13jVGjl
Finally pumpkin spice has some autumn competition. Eager to try this @UofNH concocted brew. https://t.co/rwEGTcNPGL

Celebrating #MadeInAmericorps week by recognizing the incredible work they are doing in communities across New Hampshire. A special thanks to @CityYearNH for all they are doing in my hometown of Manchester to help students learn & grow. https://t.co/VplhuIoLVy

Great to be with Planned Parenthood and supporters last night. I will continue to fight with the rest of the NH delegation for women's reproductive rights family planning services and access to health care. https://t.co/aYfkuE60pc
Another day another article about the GOP putting a target on our back. Click here https://t.co/C1AC7EHpqU to donate today and demonstrate that when tested we win! https://t.co/Qplz2jJp0m
Agreed! We need a fair and open internet and that’s why I’m co-sponsoring the Save the Internet Act. Thanks for the feedback and all you do. https://t.co/mjmPXQSBCY

Right now corporate special interests have too much say in D.C. Politicians are making it harder to vote. Members of Congress use their offices to benefit themselves. We can reverse these trends and get Congress back to work for you by making the #ForThePeople Act law. #HR1 https://t.co/llDnOMt5Pn

Glad to be working with @NHYoungDems to build support for #HR1 the #ForThePeople Act. Join us in support of this important democracy reform measure by signing our petition: https://t.co/eYa6zxDqOj https://t.co/xVc80a7SLS

THREAD: If you support protecting and expanding voting access fixing our broken campaign finance system and ending the culture of corruption in Washington sign our petition with @NHYoungDems to support #HR1 the #ForThePeople Act. https://t.co/eYa6zxDqOj https://t.co/nmgbNcFXqN

#HR1 the #ForThePeople Act will🤝end the culture of corruption🤝. How? ✅Stop Congress from corp. board membership ✅No taxpayer-funded discrimination settlements ✅Require 10 yrs of presidential tax returns ✅Close foreign agent/lobbyist loopholes ✅Strengthen @OfficeGovEthics

#HR1 the #ForThePeople Act will help 💸fix our broken campaign finance system💸. How? ✅Ban foreign money ✅Ensure online political ad disclosure ✅Require political orgs to disclose big donors ✅Incentivize small-dollar donors ✅Restructure the Federal Election Commission

#HR1 the #ForThePeople Act will 🗳️protect and expand voting access🗳️. How? ✅Automatic voter registration ✅Expand early voting & voting hours ✅Fund election protection infrastructure ✅Stop voter roll purges ✅Restore voting rights for felons who have served their sentence

In order to tackle big issues like climate change & student debt we must end the culture of corruption in Washington get big money out of politics & make it easier to vote. Sign our petition with @NHYoungDems to support #HR1 the #ForThePeople Act. https://t.co/eYa6zxDqOj

Today I joined @NHYoungDems to make a push for #HR1 the #ForThePeople Act which will: 1. Fix our broken campaign finance system 2. End the culture of corruption in Washington 3. Make it easier to vote  We must push this crucial reform package & restore faith in our democracy. https://t.co/9NWQIApKqm

Headed back to DC today with notes of encouragement from constituents to support H.R. 1 the #ForthePeople Act. It’s time to end corporate special interest influence and return the power of our democracy to the people. #NHPolitics https://t.co/kyDcrUxQB9

There is building bipartisan opposition to President Trump's national emergency declaration and for good reason. It isn't just bad policy it is an unconstitutional end run around Congress that should not be allowed to stand. https://t.co/NxaLX94vui

We must support trans youth. We cannot continue to allow school policies that tell students it's not okay to be who they are. Transgender equality is law in NH & it should be federal law as well. https://t.co/OhF0tCI5VQ

Celebrating the life of Dr. Seuss on his 115th birthday which is now 'Read Across America Day.' Recently I joined students in Exeter to celebrate his outstanding legacy which includes inspiring children to be excited about reading. https://t.co/a7VV7mwWw8
Excited to see @FedEx & Manchester's own DEKA Research partnering for this incredible new autonomous SameDay delivery bot! https://t.co/By8iIWbjbI

My constituents are still feeling the sting of the recent government shutdown. Our communities shouldn’t be pawns in a political fight. I hope the far reaching impacts of this mess have made it clear that we should never engage in shutdown politics again. https://t.co/lNRmNtLQad

THIS is the #CostOfInaction both in terms of repairing infrastructure and addressing climate change. We need to fix our outdated transportation infrastructure ensure its resiliency and help reduce our carbon footprint. #ActOnClimate https://t.co/fco7dh4lYI

Capping out-of-pocket drug costs for Medicare recipients is necessary given the escalating burden seniors face. Every day I talk to constituents I hear about the need to address this now. https://t.co/gzXPMKfLtd

The White House's "ad hoc working group" is simply an orchestrated excuse to ignore the clear climate science that tells us we urgently need bold action.   It's as much a sham as the Administration's now-disbanded voter fraud commission. https://t.co/7wvXojHeWs

My three big takeaways from the first couple months in Congress: 1. This freshman class is ready to change Washington. 2. I'm serving with the best delegation in the U.S. with @JeanneShaheen @Maggie_Hassan & @AnnMcLaneKuster. 3. If we stick together we can make things happen. https://t.co/XiW8EIFtGh
Another tremendous McIntyre-Shaheen Dinner by @NHDems. Congratulations to all of tonight's award winners. Let's continue to work hard to set the stage for a successful 2020! https://t.co/wUMVU28NY1

Today the Trump Admin. decided to strip away #TitleX funding for health care providers that offer women basic family planning options & educational information. This backwards policy is an affront to the health & safety of our communities and we must fight it. https://t.co/mOdLskNZst

This morning I was honored to congratulate 79 new American citizens at a naturalization ceremony in Concord. This country is strengthened and enriched by immigrants from all corners of the globe and I’m proud to call them my fellow Americans. https://t.co/qjEeKxLVz3

Incredibly relieved to hear that the @NCSBE voted unanimously in favor of a new election in #NC09. The integrity of our elections and faith in the democratic process are more important than the victory of any candidate or party. https://t.co/wIqECxkC5m

This afternoon I hosted a roundtable with transportation planners from around New Hampshire. As a member of the House T&I Committee I’m eager to get to work addressing regional state and national infrastructural needs. https://t.co/Rm7vL2kMS5

Thanks again to everyone who joined our town hall at Lakes Region Community College this evening. I'm eager to get to work on the issues we talked about and ensure Washington is responding to community needs. https://t.co/5QuU7qbSjz

I joined Senator @Maggie_Hassan and Mayor Karen Weston to help cut the ribbon on the outstanding new @revisionsolar array at the @kidmuseumnh Dover. Also got to check out the new 'City in the Sea' mural designed by an amazing local student Sofia Self. https://t.co/3b2alkzMSF
Great. While you’re at it let’s pass the Equality Act and reverse the transgender military service ban. https://t.co/QhSGgN3XrN
Took part in 'Read Across America' this afternoon with a group of students at Main Street School in Exeter. https://t.co/b86tRU0uNs

With the bipartisan compromise passed and the threat of another shutdown behind us it's time to get on with the people’s business. I'm eager to get to work on priorities and hear from constituents about how my office can be of assistance. https://t.co/W08xQiPzj6

This marks one year since 17 lives were tragically lost at Marjory Stoneman Douglas HS in #Parkland FL. Today we pause for a moment of remembrance. Tomorrow we wake up inspired by the resilience of the MSD community & ready to fight for common sense gun safety reform. https://t.co/0H82vJndFS

This project by teen journalists is remarkable. In the 12 months since #Parkland 1200 American kids have been killed by guns. Teen journalists are telling 1200 stories about their lives. https://t.co/oPF96NSn2C

It's pretty simple: "If you're fit to serve you should be able to serve however you identify."  Thanks again to Tavion for sharing his story & helping us raise the injustice of the trans military service ban at the #SOTU. https://t.co/aSwxRhFZ2K

This morning we kicked off ’Valentines for Veterans’ at Parker-Varney School with an amazing group of fourth graders. In partnership with @CityYearNH students helped @MayorJoyceCraig & me make Valentines Day cards to give to local New Hampshire veterans. #ValentinesForVets https://t.co/bhA6mipXmy

Great to see so many Oyster River teams working hard (even through lunch & recess!) to gear up for the state robitics competition. Looking forward to seeing which NH team comes out on top. It's fantastic to see so many students finding a passion for STEM. https://t.co/QVE725RmWI

29 years ago Nelson Mandela was freed from a jail cell after spending 27 years "prepared to die" for the cause of justice. His spirit perseverance and leadership changed the world. Taking a moment to appreciate him this #BlackHistoryMonth. https://t.co/zgCLXUBFUI

Rest In Peace Walter Jones.  He had a distinguished career in public service and always put the country first before the interests of his party.  We will miss him and the honesty integrity and bipartisan spirit he brought to the Congress. https://t.co/oeoRZnfbn4
For the love of science can someone please take his phone away? https://t.co/J2BNAEiIRp

Of all the hotel bars in all the towns in all the world he walks into @realDonaldTrump’s? https://t.co/vH9OMTJLfn
